problem.p: You drop a ball (initially at rest) from a height of 12 meters above the ground. You can neglect air resistance. Which statements are true about this situation?

optionresponse.p: The kinetic energy of the ball will be twice the gravitational potential energy when the ball is at a height of 2 meters
The kinetic energy of the ball will be twice the gravitational potential energy when the ball is at a height of 4 meters
The kinetic energy of the ball will be twice the gravitational potential energy when the ball is at a height of 6 meters
The kinetic energy of the ball will be twice the gravitational potential energy when the ball is at a height of 8 meters
